definitions.definition: A Roman unit of liquid measure reckoned as the volume of 10 Roman pounds of wine and equivalent to about 3.3 L although differing slightly over time .
A Roman unit of mass instituted by Vespasian equivalent to about 3.3 kg , the weight of a congius of water .

main_definition: ( historical ) A Roman unit of liquid measure reckoned as the volume of 10 Roman pounds of wine and equivalent to about 3.3 L although differing slightly over time .
secondary_definitions: ( historical ) A Roman unit of mass instituted by Vespasian equivalent to about 3.3 kg , the weight of a congius of water .
